alert.note: Alert for Osage; Pawnee (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued March 04 at 3:07AM CST until March 05 at 8:00PM CST by NWS Tulsa
info.description: .A dry line will move into portions of northeast Oklahoma Saturday afternoon with dry and gusty west to southwest winds. ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH SATURDAY EVENING FOR VERY DRY AND WINDY CONDITIONS FOR PORTIONS OF NORTHEAST OKLAHOMA... The National Weather Service in Tulsa has issued a Fire Weather Watch, which is in effect from Saturday afternoon through Saturday evening. * AFFECTED AREA...In Oklahoma, Osage, and Pawnee counties. * WIND...Gusty west to southwest wind at 20 to 30 mph. * HUMIDITY...Afternoon RH values falling into the 20 to 25 percent range. * TEMPERATURE...Unseasonably warm conditions with highs around 80 degrees. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: A fire weather watch means that critical fire weather conditions are forecast to occur.
